etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French berberis (see berberis). The change in the ending was due to association with berry

definitions: a thorny shrub that bears yellow flowers and red or blue-black berries.

notes.text: Genus Berberis, family Berberidaceae: many species, including the American barberry (B. canadensis), with widely toothed leaves, and the European barberry (B. vulgaris), with more closely toothed leaves

shortDefinitions: spiny shrub with yellow flowers and red berries
